subject: linear_algebra

problem.statementHtml:
Consider two block matrices A and B, where
A = [A11 | A12; A21 | A22] and B = [B11 | B12; B21 | B22].
Find the product C = AB in terms of the blocks.
hints: Focus on one block at a time, like multiplying a row from A with a column from B
Use the distributive property for matrix multiplication
The blocks can be multiplied independently
problem.solutionHtml:
To find the product C = AB, we multiply each block of A with the corresponding block of B:

  • C11 = A11B11 + A12B21
  • C12 = A11B12 + A12B22
  • C21 = A21B11 + A22B21
  • C22 = A21B12 + A22B22

commonMistakes: Forgetting to multiply each block independently

subject: linear_algebra
statementHtml: Consider two block matrices A and B, where A is a 3x2 matrix and B is a 2x4 matrix. Find the product C = A · B.
hints: Think about how you would multiply individual elements of A with corresponding elements of B
Consider the block structure of both matrices and how it affects the multiplication process
Use the associative property of matrix multiplication to simplify your calculation
solutionHtml:
To find the product C = A · B, we first multiply individual elements of A with corresponding elements of B:

\[C_{11} = (A_{11} \* B_{11}) + (A_{12} \* B_{21}),\]

\[C_{12} = (A_{11} \* B_{12}) + (A_{12} \* B_{22}),\]

\[\ldots\]

Finally, we combine the results to get the final product C.

subject: linear_algebra
statementHtml:
Consider two block matrices A and B:

\[A = \begin{bmatrix} A_{11} & A_{12} \\ A_{21} & A_{22} \end{bmatrix},\]\[B = \begin{bmatrix} B_{11} & B_{12} \\ B_{21} & B_{22} \end{bmatrix}\]

Find the product AB.

",
hints: Block matrices can be multiplied element-wise, just like regular matrices.
When multiplying block matrices, you only need to consider the blocks that interact with each other.
Use the distributive property of matrix multiplication to simplify the product.
solutionHtml:
To find the product AB, we multiply corresponding blocks:

\[AB = \begin{bmatrix} A_{11}B_{11} + A_{12}B_{21} & A_{11}B_{12} + A_{12}B_{22} \\ A_{21}B_{11} + A_{22}B_{21} & A_{21}B_{12} + A_{22}B_{22} \end{bmatrix}\]",
